sub_title: International Manager Reporting and Tax bij Basic-Fit International B.V.

profile_positions.title: International Manager Reporting and Tax

profile_positions.description:
Basic-Fit International B.V. was founded in 2010 and grew rapidly from 32 clubs in 2010 to 200 discount gyms (clubs) in the Netherlands, Belgium, Spain and France by the end of 2013. This growth was realised by the conversion of HealthCity clubs to Basic-Fit model and by opening new clubs. At the end of 2013 Leisure Group Europe (covering the brands HealthCity and Basic-Fit) sold its participation in Basic-Fit International B.V. to the founders of LGE and to international invester 3i Group plc (http://www.3i.com/news/corporate-news/3i-invests-basic-fit-leading-discount-fitness-operator-europe).

In 2014 I have transferred my work for HealthCity and as of January 2014 I am responsible for the consolidation, reporting and budgetting of the total Basic-Fit International group. I report directly to the CFO and CEO.

Basic-Fit grew in 2014 from 200 clubs in January to 268 clubs in December. Also for 2015 huge growth is foreseen. For more information: www.basic-fit.com
Achievements in 2014:
- Setup Master Chart of Accounts for the group
- Setup Transfer Pricing documentation
- Preperations for conversion to IFRS, including setup new Accounting Manual

In 2015 the company grew to 338 clubs.
At the end of the year the finance department was restructured in 3 deparments:
- Financial Shared Service Center
- Planning & Control
- Reporting & Tax
I transfered part of my responsibilities related to the shared service center and started at 1 January 2016 as "International Manager Reporting & Tax".
profile_positions.title: International Finance Manager

profile_positions.description:
From December 2005 until December 2013 Leisure Group Europe (covering the brands HealthCity and Basic-Fit) grew from 20 fitnessclubs in the Netherlands to more than 280 fitness clubs in the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Germany, France, Italy and Spain. The biggest acquisitions were Basic-Fit (32 clubs in 2010) and Fitness First (58 clubs in 2010 and 45 clubs in 2011).

As International Financial Controller I was responsible for consolidation, reporting and budgetting of the total group and reported directly to the CFO and CEO. In the 8 years I worked for the company I coördinated several restructurings (mergers, splits) of the group in order to integrate acquisitions and to keep the group structure clear. I was responsible for the reporting to management, shareholders and auditors, including the preparation of tax returns in the Netherlands.

Some other achievements:
- 2007: Implementation of scanning- and approvalsoftware for purchase invoices
- 2008: Setup Financial Shared Service Center for the entire financial administration of all group companies in the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg and Germany
- 2009/2010: Setup Fixed Assets Register and Transfer Pricing Documentation
- 2010/2011: Due Diligences of Basic-Fit and Fitness First and integration in our group after acquisition
- 2011: Implementation of a fast and efficient reporting system (LucaNet) which includes both financial information (P&L, Balance Sheet, CashFlow) and non-financiel information (memberbase/joiners/leavers, headcount, FTE, opening hours, square meters per club, etc). LucaNet makes it possible to analyse and report this information at clublevel, regional level, country level, per entity, Group level or any other cross-sectional you prefer
- 2011/2012: Further improvement of the budget- and reforecast-process within LucaNet
- 2013: Providing detailed information for the Vendor Due Diligence Report and for the Dataroom (as LGE was looking for a new private equity company for Basic-Fit)
